thread.title: Alaska Airlines plans daily nonstop flights between Portland and Minneapolis
thread.title_full: Alaska Airlines plans daily nonstop flights between Portland and Minneapolis

author: Jim Hammerand
title: Alaska Airlines plans daily nonstop flights between Portland and Minneapolis
text:
Alaska Airlines plans daily nonstop flights between Portland and Minneapolis Jul 30, 2015, 11:12am CDT Industries & Tags Jim Hammerand Digital editor Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal Jim Hammerand Digital editor Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal Alaska Arlines Embraer E175â€¦ more Related Content Alaska Airlines Alaska Arlines flies 76-passenger Embrauer E175 regional jets Alaska Airlines plans to add daily nonstop flights between Portland (Ore.) International Airport and Minneapolis-St. Paul International Airport . Starting Feb. 18, Alaska Airlines Flight 3384 is scheduled to land in Minnesota every day at 4:16 p.m. and leave for Portland at 5 p.m. as Flight 3385. The flights are scheduled on 76-passenger Embraer 175 regional jets , which have 12 first-class seats (with power outlets) and 64 in coach. Skywest Airlines will operate the flights. "Onboard amenities will include Alaska Beyond Delicious, featuring food and beverages sourced with items from iconic Pacific Northwest brands, and Inflight Internet access," the airline said in a news release . "The planes are also equipped with Alaska Beyond Entertainment, which offers free and premium entertainment direct to customer devices." Flying from Portland will take an estimated 3 hours and 21 minutes; the return trip is estimated at 4:08. One-way promotional fares as low as $139 are available if purchased by Aug. 5. Alaska Airlines is a subsidiary of Seattle-based Alaska Air Group Inc. (NYSE: ALK) 
Want Minneapolis / St. Paul Travel
